subject: RE: regarding class not found error
msgSnippet: I m sorry, I m busy at work and don t have time to do that, but I m fairly sure it s nothing to do with your code. I m forwarding this back to the list in the
messageBody:
I'm sorry, I'm busy at work and don't have time to do that, but I'm
fairly sure it's nothing to do with your code. I'm forwarding this back to
the list in the hopes that someone else can help you.

-----Original Message-----
From: anupama [mailto:anupama@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 26, 2003 8:23 AM
To: Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-ALB)
Subject: Re: regarding class not found error


I have tried it in the way which u have suggested me but the same error is
coming .can u please go through my code ,so that u can get find any errors
which is leading to this error.

thanks
Anupama
----- Original Message -----

From: Stevens, Timothy J. <mailto:Timothy.J.Stevens@...>
(LNG-ALB)
To: 'anupama' <mailto:anupama@...>
Sent: Thursday, June 26, 2003 5:38 PM
Subject: RE: regarding class not found error


Wait, if the class is TestHelloClass and it's in the samples package,
why are you saying junit.samples.TestHelloClass? Try it again like this:

java junit.awtui.TestRunner samples.TestHelloClass

-----Original Message-----
From: anupama [mailto:anupama@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 26, 2003 8:07 AM
To: Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-ALB)
Subject: Re: regarding class not found error


My class file is in
c:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1\junit\samples\TestHelloClass.class.
and i am running from that directory itself as
c:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1\junit\samples>java junit.awtui.TestRunner
junit.samples.TestHelloClass

Is there any thing wrong in running in the above procedure.I am not able to
understand where i am going wrong.

Thanks
Anupama

----- Original Message -----
From: Stevens, Timothy J. <mailto:Timothy.J.Stevens@...>
(LNG-ALB)
To: 'anupama' <mailto:anupama@...>
Sent: Thursday, June 26, 2003 5:29 PM
Subject: RE: regarding class not found error


If your class is samples.TestClass, from the C:\ directory in a command
prompt you must type "java samples\TestClass"
